Pulse Protocol: Cell held at -60mv. Stepwise rectangular 200ms Current injection. First AP used for feature extraction.
label: Start current (holding to -60 mV)

Explanation: Current Injection needed for first AP
label: Threshold current (first AP)

Comment: defined as the minimum of the first derivative of the action potential
label: AP threshold voltage

Comment: half distance between threshold and peak is taken and the distance between this point during depolarization and repolarization is measured
label: Action potential duration

Explanation: max slope between TH and peak
label: Max upstroke slope (raw)

Explanation: max slope in overshoot >0mV of AP
label: Upstroke overshoot slope

Explanation: max slope between RMP and Threshhold
label: Subthreshold I–V slope

Explanation: The time to peak is the duration between current pulse onset and action potential peak
label: Time to peak

Explanation: Area of AP Shoulder. No reliable measurement, can be excluded.
label: Shoulder

Comment: 1 Exponential fit to repolarization phase after AP
label: AHP repolarization kinetics

Explanation: Measured Potential in Spike used for data extraction
Comment: QC measure to rule out potential variation as reason for changed spike features
label: RMP Before AP

Explanation: existance of 2nd infliction point in descending phase ("Shoulder")
label: 2nd Infliction

Explanation: Number of spikes (0-20) given for each frequency
Pulse Protocol: 2ms 1000Pa Injection of different velocity up to 100 Hz
label: 2hz

Explanation: Number of spikes (0-20) given for each frequency
label: 4hz

Explanation: Number of spikes (0-20) given for each frequency
label: 10hz

Explanation: Number of spikes (0-20) given for each frequency
label: 20hz

Explanation: Number of spikes (0-20) given for each frequency
label: 50hz

Explanation: Number of spikes (0-20) given for each frequency
label: 100hz

Explanation: Spike Threshold in half sinus stmilation
label: High-spiking threshold

Explanation: Number of spikes in doubled half sinus threshold
label: Spike count at 2× Half-sinus threshold

Comment: Defined as difference in number of Spikes in each protocol -> theoretical max 20 (20 Sinus spikes vs 0 rectangular spikes) , min -20 (20 rectangualr spikes 0 sinus spikes)
Pulse Protocol: 20 4 Hz Sinus Stimulation. 5s Break. 20 4Hz Rectangular Injection of same intensity. Intensitiy was similar or slightly higher as in Std AP pulse protocol.
label: Sinus score

Pulse Protocol: 500ms Half Sinus Shaped Current Injection: rel TH as quotient to AP Threshold in standart Current Injection Protocol
label: High-spiking quotient

Explanation: Relative change in action current maximum in rep. Stimulation
Comment: Baseline = first Peak. Action current = firstdeviation AP Trace * cSlow (constant)
label: Initial action current change (ΔI)

Explanation: Change in resting membrane potential in rep Stimulation
label: Resting membrane potential change (ΔRMP)
